column4: The target and actual service performance goals that are tracked by contact center management

column4: The target and actual contact center service schedule - recording planned and actual service availability and outages (includes any partial service access constraints or restrictions for a 24/7 service)

Contact Center Management: CR Contact Center Management Plan Instance Record
column4: The default contact center operational configuration (Note this can include some latitude for position assignment changes to be made during day to day operations with service calls to the Contact Center Operations service domain)

column4: Details the number and skill profile of the contact center staff (target and actual)

column4: Details of staff training and certification activity
Record of the contact center position target and actual utilization
Estimated projected contact center resource requirements and utilization and loading based on historical patterns and anticipated activity
Tracked activity and performance statistics used to manage the contact center set-up and to inform staff training
The type of activity that is tracked and analyzed (e.g. wait time, average handle time, dropped call ratio, resolution rate)
The statistical analysis that can include historical and trended views of the activity
The evaluation of the root cause or comparative assessments of the analysis
Service/configuration amendment recommendations arising from the statistical analysis
A record of any production issues arising during the session (see Advanced Voice Channel Operations for detailed content)

column3: Contact Center Issue Analysis And Recommended Response
column4: A record of the root cause analysis for recurring issues and suggested remedial action
